intro: Pimpinella bipinnata, commonly known as the double-pinnate carrot, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its finely divided, bipinnate leaves that resemble those of the carrot. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Pimpinella bipinnata is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate foliage and historical use in herbal medicine.
